page.title: 04Kettlesing - Menwith Hill
page.content: Menwith Hill, part of the larger civil parish of Menwith-with-Darley, covers the entire western quarter of the block. It is an area of high, rough moor- land, with a maximum altitude of 230 metres near Round Wood, and falling steeply through rich grazing land with rocky outcrops (e.g., Cinder Hills- evidence of old quarry workings), to the valley of the Nidd, directly to the north of the block at Darley. Agriculture consists of dairying on the lush slopes and sheep on the rougher moorland top. The joint U.S./M.O.D. Communications Base covers almost 2 sq.km. on the summit of Menwith Hill.
